title: Narendra Hirwani, The Man Who Took 16 Wickets On Test Debut Only To Be Cast Into The Footnotes Of History
text:
Narendra Hirwani, The Man Who Took 16 Wickets On Test Debut Only To Be Cast Into The Footnotes Of History

Narendra Hirwani, The Man Who Took 16 Wickets On Test Debut Only To Be Cast Into The Footnotes Of History

Remember Narendra Hirwani? Most cricket fans of this century probably have no idea who he is.

Luckily for those of us who grew up watching cricket in the 1990s, there is still something of a blur to remind us of a man who has been forgotten in the pages of Indian cricket history.

Wisden

Sadly, one cannot blame the average fan for forgetting him. For the man himself faded into oblivion and one has to go further back to realise just what an asset he was to Team India.

Sensational debut

16 wickets in a Test is no mean feat, but to do it on your debut is something very special. Yes, the man grabbed 8 in each innings against West Indies in 1988 and helped India crush them by 255 runs. These are the best match figures on Test debut.

Man of the series in Sharjah

Hirwani became the first Indian to take 4 wickets in 3 consecutive matches.

YouTube

Don't Miss 544 SHARES 835 SHARES 280 SHARES 4.8 K SHARES

Hit by bad form in West Indies

When India toured West Indies in 1989, his bowling was attacked by the batsmen and even on tracks he could not do any damage

Left out of World Cup

Dip in form meant he did not find a place in the 1992 World Cup.

Reuters

Comeback in 1996

He had a good series against New Zealand and toured England as well before being out of favour once again.

No longer in consideration

In 2001 he was picked in the squad to play Australia but not the playing eleven. Slowly it led to him no longer being considered for matches. He took over 400 wickets for Madhya Pradesh in Ranji trophy and retired from first-class cricket at the end of the 2005–06 season. In 2014, he was appointed as the chairman of the Ranji Trophy Tournament Selection Committee of the Madhya Pradesh Cricket Association.
